intro: Ranunculus constans, commonly known as the constant buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features delicate, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, with 5 to 15 petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 10 to 30 centimeters, with trifoliate leaves that are deeply lobed. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Ranunculus constans is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
